Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Demotic ostracon
Description: This piece of pottery carries a text written in Demotic concerning the payment of the "poll tax", probably  an individual annual tax to which each egyptian, aged between 14 and 60 years, had been subjected by the roman emperors. The document is dated Year 43 of the reign of Augustus, or  the 7th April of the year 14 after Christ.
